item.title: Dhaka rejects Indian advice on election process: Touhid
item.description: Foreign Adviser Md Touhid Hossain today said Dhaka does not seek advice from India on Bangladesh’s election process, calling New Delhi’s recent comments unacceptable while reaffirming the interim government’s commitment to holding a free, fair and credible national election. “We do not want advice from our neighbours on how elections in Bangladesh should be held,” he said while responding to journalists’ questions at the Foreign Ministry here this afternoon. item.title: Russia wants Dhaka-Delhi to reduce tension
item.description: Russian Ambassador Alexander Grigoryevich Khozin today urged Bangladesh and India to reduce domestic tensions between the neighbouring countries. Speaking at a press briefing at the Embassy of the Russian Federation in Dhaka, the Ambassador underscored the importance of de-escalating tensions with India "the sooner the better," while stressing that Russia does not interfere in bilateral relations between the two countries. item.title: Hybrid postal voting system to set global example: CEC
item.description: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) A M M Nasir Uddin has said Bangladesh’s newly introduced ‘hybrid postal voting’ is expected to become a model for countries around the world. He made the remarks while talking to journalists after inspecting postal ballot operations at the Tejgaon Mail Processing Centre in the capital this afternoon. “We are hopeful that this hybrid model (online registration combine manual counting of postal ballots) will emerge as a global example,” the CEC said. item.title: Hamas official says Egypt to host Palestinian conference on Gaza future
item.description: A senior Hamas official said Saturday that Egypt would organise a conference for Palestinian factions to decide on the post-war future of the Gaza Strip, after the group accepted to release hostages under a US ceasefire plan. Egypt will host an "intra-Palestinian dialogue on Palestinian unity and the future of Gaza, including the administration of the Gaza Strip", the official told AFP. item.title: Highest security for Tarique Rahman's homecoming on Dec 25: Home Adviser
item.description: Home Adviser Lieutenant General (Retd) Md Jahangir Alam Chowdhury has said the highest level of security will be ensured for the homecoming of Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on December 25. "Maximum security measures have already been taken to ensure the safe arrival of Tarique Rahman in the country," he said.
